From Our Friends at Remake Learning: You and your family are in the middle of what is already an unprecedented start to the school year, not to mention all we experienced last spring. You’re processing lessons already learned and adjusting to new ways of preparing your kids.

A lot of us are asking...So Now What?

The So Now What? virtual series brings the country’s leading experts in education and childhood development, including PBS Kids, Common Sense Media, Learning Heroes, and UPMC Children’s Hospital, together with parents and caregivers to share and learn from one another. We will cover a range of topics specific to this moment in time, including social-emotional wellness, mental health, learning resources, communication, tech safety, and much more.

Together we will navigate the start to this new, uncharted school year, and make plans for what comes next, no matter what tomorrow brings.

I look forward to sharing our work with you today.

Sincerely,

Randal A. Lutz, Ed.D.

Superintendent of Schools

Baldwin-Whitehall School District has been honored again with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education. Seven hundred and fifty-four school districts were recognized nationwide, with Baldwin-Whitehall representing one of the 114 districts in Pennsylvania one of the only 16 districts in Allegheny County.

This award recognizes that Baldwin-Whitehall School District is leading the way with learning opportunities as outlined in the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA). The legislation guides implementation in the states and replaces the No Child Left Behind Act (NCLB) which was often criticized for an overemphasis on testing-while leaving behind subjects such as music. ESSA recommends music and the arts as important elements of a well-rounded education for all children.

Congratulations to all of our music educators! You have enriched the lives of our students and our communities with your dedication and professionalism.

Additionally, the District will now begin in earnest, the planning of any alternatives to the celebrations and other events that normally take place at this time of year.

Thank you.
Randy Lutz

They are meant to support and enrich learning that has taken place in the classroom as of last Friday.

Thank you,

Randy Lutz

Due to an issue with the boiler at J.E. Harrison Middle School, all HMS students on buses are currently being redirected to Baldwin High School. The high school’s main office phone number is: 412-885-7500.

Should anything change throughout the day, we will notify you via phone and email using the Skylert system.

From May 9th–19th, schools across Southwestern Pennsylvania and West Virginia will host hands-on learning events. On May 15th, the Baldwin-Whitehall School District will host Paynter's Pathway to Possibilities at W. R. Paynter Elementary School. RemakeLearningDays returns for the fourth year to highlight the ways educators are innovating in the classroom. From May 9th–19th, schools across Southwestern Pennsylvania and West Virginia will host hands-on learning events. On May 15th, the Baldwin-Whitehall School District will host Paynter's Pathway to Possibilities at W. R. Paynter Elementary School. Attendees will get to experience green screens, robotics, vinyl cutting, and more! During this night of interactive and engaging fun for all, students and their families will have many opportunities to engage in some of the innovative experiences that highlight what STEAM education looks like in elementary schools.

Check out the PES event here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/remake-learning-days-2019-paynters-pathway-to-possibilities-tickets-55411706907

A big win for the staff of The Purbalite!

School Newspapers Online (SNO) judges school newspaper websites in six areas: Writing, Multimedia, Continuous Coverage, Audience Engagement, Story Page Excellence and Site Excellence.

For the first time ever, purbalite.net has earned top scores in all categories, winning a designation as a "Distinguished Site." About 400 high school newspaper websites nationwide are involved in this competition; so far just 30 have earned the "Distinguished Site" status. A special shout out to The Purbalite sponsor, Mr. Keith Harrison, for his dedication to teaching our students the foundational skills necessary to be responsible journalists.

Congratulations!

There exists a vacancy on the Baldwin-Whitehall School Board. To be considered for the position of School Director a candidate must be a citizen of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, at least 18 years old, registered to vote, of good moral character and a resident of the Baldwin-Whitehall School District for at least one year prior to the date of appointment to the position. Anyone who is interested in serving on the School Board should submit a letter of interest and resume, including any information they wish the Board of School Directors to consider in making a decision on filling this vacancy. Letters of interest must be received no later than 3:00 p.m. April 20, 2018 in the Office of the Superintendent, Baldwin-Whitehall School District, 4900 Curry Road, Pittsburgh, PA 15236.

Interviews for the position will be conducted by the Board in a public meeting on April 23, 2018 in the Administration Center located at 4900 Curry Road, Pittsburgh, PA 15236, starting at 7:30 p.m.

Theanita Hampsay

Board Secretary

About the Disability Summit: The disability arena has plenty of great seminars for people to attend. However, many such events require travel and cost that are impractical for the average family. Our goal is to bring informative sessions and the best collection of resources to western PA – for free. We will continue to work to increase independence and opportunity for every person, and we believe this year’s Summit is another rung on the ladder to a more inclusive and fulfilling Pennsylvania.

The 7th annual Transition & Employment Fair will be taking place in the BHS gymnasium on November 9th from 6-8 PM. This is a great opportunity for people to get information on various post-secondary schools, agencies, and programs that could benefit many students after graduation. There will be over 50 vendors sharing information, as well as 3 breakout sessions. In addition, if anyone is looking for various types of employment, there will be recruiters at this event looking to fill current job openings.

This event is open to anyone age 14 or older. It is open to the public, not just students from Baldwin-Whitehall. While many of the vendors will be most appropriate for students with disabilities, there is still a great deal of information to be gained from many of the other vendors who will be in attendance.

Please join Senator Jay Costa, state and national teen suicide prevention organizations, and medical and educational professionals for a discussion on teen suicide awareness and prevention.

Teens and young adults, now more than ever have the I world as their audience via social media. This creates a space where they broadcast their lives in real time. Unfortunately some are starting to use those forums to broadcast disturbing and harmful acts, including suicide, as reported by many national news outlets. With the Netflix series "13 Reasons Why" putting teen suicide at the forefront of main-stream media, I felt it imperative to bring parents, medical and educational professionals as well as suicide prevention advocates together to discuss this important issue. Let's work together to save lives.

We are excited to announce the launch of our new website! You can still access it using the URL, bwschools.net.

Our goal with this new website is to provide our visitors with an easier way to learn about the Baldwin-Whitehall School District and access the information and services that they are looking for, while also learning about the amazing opportunities that our students have throughout their K-12 experience.

Among the many new features, the new site contains integrated social media buttons for Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube to foster improved communication with our district’s families and residents.

We hope you enjoy the fresh look of the new website, are easily able to access information, and use this site as a source of information to stay current with the happenings occurring throughout the district.
